definitions.definition: Something (usually money) given in exchange for influence or as an inducement to dishonesty.
To give a bribe to; specifically, to ask a person to do something, usually against his/her will, in exchange for some type of reward or relief from potential trouble.
definitions.example: She was accused of trying to bribe the jury into making false statements.

definitions.definition: To gain by a bribe; to induce as by a bribe.
